intro: Mammillaria multiformis, commonly known as the variable mammillaria, is a species of cactus native to Mexico. It is characterized by its short, cylindrical stems that are often covered in white or pale green spines. The plant produces small, white or pink flowers during the spring and summer months. It thrives in well-draining soil and requires minimal water, making it suitable for arid environments. Due to its compact size and unique appearance, it is a popular choice for rock gardens and indoor collections.
